==Chinese==
{{zh-forms|lit=heaven flower}}

===Etymology===
Originally the Chinese translation of several {{der|zh|sa|-}} and {{der|zh|pi|-}} words, including {{cog|sa|खपुष्प||flower in the sky}}, as well as several plant names, such as {{cog|sa|दिव्यपुष्प||[[oleander]] [heaven-flower]}} / {{cog|pi|devapuppha}}, and {{cog|sa|शालपुष्प||{{vern|confederate rose}} [house-flower]}}.

The development from “heaven-flower” (or other interpretations of the combination) to “smallpox” is unknown. It may be due to the shape resemblance of smallpox [[pustule]]s to the divine flowers in Buddhism. Compare {{cog|bo|ལྷ་འབྲུམ||smallpox [deva-pustule]}}, {{m|bo|མེ་ཏོག||flower; (dialectal) smallpox}}, and {{cog|mn|ᠰᠠᠯᠬᠢᠨ ᠴᠡᠴᠡᠭ}} / {{m|mn|салхин цэцэг||smallpox; chickenpox [wind-flower]}}.
